result.execSummary:
The defendant Chandler J Sagan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).
  • Unlawful Phone Use-Threatens Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.012(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent to count 2, Credit of 4 days time served. Huber Privileges for work and treatment.

miscConds.notes:
- Court set restitution at $0.
- Defendant to pay ALL costs and surcharges (DNA and DV) during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
- Full time work, school or a combination.
- Court will grant expungement upon successful completion of probation.

- No violent contact with victim.
- No use of possession of firearms.

- Batter intervention program.
- Mental health assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Provide a DNA sample

- Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Maintain absolute sobriety. Random UAs.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent to count 1, Credit of 4 days time served, Huber Privileges for work and treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chandler J Sagan

defendant.name: Sagan, Chandler J
defendant.address: 10455 South Mcgraw Drive, Oak Creek, WI 53154

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Chandler J Sagan in court.  Attorney Benjamin Wallis Lutgen in court for Chandler J Sagan.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statement by AG.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant ordered to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, credit of 4 days time served, Huber Privileges for work and treatment.  Court STAYED the sentences and placed the defendant on probation for 18 months all concurrent to count 2.

AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant ordered to serve 60 DAYS in the House of Correction, credit of 4 days time served, Huber Privileges for work and treatment.  Court STAYED the sentences and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months all concurrent to count 1.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

- Batter intervention program.
- Mental health assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Maintain absolute sobriety. Random UAs.
- No violent contact with victim.
- No use of possession of firearms.
- Full time work, school or a combination.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Court set restitution at $0.

Defendant to pay ALL costs and surcharges (DNA and DV) during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

*** Court will grant expungement upon successful completion of probation.

Defendant Chandler J Sagan in court.  Attorney Benjamin Wallis Lutgen in court for Chandler J Sagan.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2: Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank. 

Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Victim Impact Statement - AG
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Received and Filed. Defendant's counseling letter

Defense counsel requests a resolution date. Court schedules case for plea and sentencing hearing on 9/16/2022 at 2:30 pm. Parties notified. Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.
Letters to Court for Plea and Sentencing, filed.
Elements of the Offense Being Entered, filed.
Plea Questionnaire, Waiver of Rights, filed.

Defendant Chandler J Sagan in court with attorney Benjamin Wallis Lutgen.  Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense requests status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Chandler J Sagan in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Chandler J Sagan in custody.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Chandler J Sagan appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Defendant may hire private counsel.  This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d9e3cc7f-7791-ec2d-80d3-5bfcdc106eb3  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with J.B. (DOB: 06/11/2007); A.G. (DOB: 10/18/2002); M.P. (DOB: 02/13/2003); S.P. (DOB: 02/13/2003); JRW (DOB: 07/25/2003); JW (DOB: 02/23/2007); or 3362 East Carollton Drive
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
